$ZIM I don’t buy for the short term. Zims already paid me more in divvies than I invested. Still the bear case seems to be 3 things going perfectly.
1. container shipping falling 75%. This could happen for sure. Will at some point
2. Zim management making no maneuvers to hedge drops in container prices. Takes no advantage of their niche market. Does nothing but what they dod during 218-2019
3. Zim management squanders 4 billion. This seems the least likely to me. If a 1 billion dollar company wins a 4 bn anti-trust case that money doesn’t disappear. It’ll be given to shareholders
shorts need all 3 t happen to justify this price or lower. I just doubt it with this company and management

17 Jun 22 JPM upgraded to Hold with $53 PT... This is now a Buy rating based on their price target....
1 Jul 22 BOA downgraded to Sell with $40 PT... This is now a Buy rating based on their price target....
20 Jul 22 Jeffereis initiated at Hold with $55 PT... This is now a Buy rating based on their price target....
19 Aug 22 Barclays maintained at Hold with $63 PT... This is now a Buy rating based on their price target....
22 Aug 22 Citigroup downgraded at Hold with $52 PT... This is now a Buy rating based on their price target....
Sure looks to me like ZIM has 5 Buy ratings here... 6 if you count Goldmans laughable $30 outlier they puked out today....

body: $ZIM  The reality in the container shipping world is that spot rates continue to follow a well-forecasted
column3: while contract rates  move sideways to higher based on the reality that container ship availability will actually contract moving into 2023 because of unprecedented levels of delayed scrapping that occurred during 2021... I'd say about 2% to 4% of the fleet is over-due for scrapping when factoring ESG considerations... While that doesn't sound like much it only takes a 1% shortage to send rates skyrocketing higher... That's how sensitive shipping rates are to supply/demand imbalances due mainly to the long lead times for new ship supply... ... The convergence of these factors along with inflation will cause rates to stabilize and form a new base run rate much higher than pre-pandemic levels...  Deeeeeeeeeply undervalued... Very bullish...

body: $ZIM  Goldman bailed out the shorts today... Don't expect their blatant market manipulation to last long... Tomorrow is a new day... One thing is for certain here... When ZIM bounces
column3: and the remaining shorts will get crushed...
